net.derquinse.common.util.concurrent

Interface RefCounted<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the disposable object.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Supplier<Disposable<T>>

    public interface RefCounted<T>
extends Supplier<Disposable<T>>
    Interface for suppliers of reference counted disposable objects. A strong reference may be kept to the destination objects, so the reference itself has to be unreachable for the destination object to be gc'd.
    Author:
    Andres Rodriguez

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Disposable<T> get()
      Returns a new disposable reference.
      int getCount()
      Returns the current number of active references.
      int getMaxCount()
      Returns the maximum number of active references.
      Future<Long> shutdown()
      Shuts the reference down using the calling thread of the last disposed reference.
      Future<Long> shutdown(Executor executor)
      Shuts the reference down.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        Disposable<T> get()
        Returns a new disposable reference. The return value will be valid until it is disposed.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Supplier<Disposable<T>>
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the object has been shut down.

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        Returns the current number of active references.

      • getMaxCount

        int getMaxCount()
        Returns the maximum number of active references.

      • shutdown

        Future<Long> shutdown(Executor executor)
        Shuts the reference down. No more references will be provided and when the last one is disposed the shutdown hook will be submitted to the provided executor. If the reference has been already shut down this method is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        executor - Executor to use for the shutdown hook.
        Returns:
        A future which result is the shuwdown hook execution time.

      • shutdown

        Future<Long> shutdown()
        Shuts the reference down using the calling thread of the last disposed reference.
        See Also:
        shutdown(Executor)
